approvePolicy(address).details: Integrates with the SecuredVault's `reportHack` function to check for hacks or account freezing

params._user: The address of the policyholder to approve

cancelPolicy().details: This sets the policy status to `Rejected` and deactivates it

params._user: The address of the policyholder to check

returns._0: `true` if the policy is valid, `false` otherwise

claimPolicy().details: The policy must be in `Approved` status for the claim to be processed

params.paymentTokenAddress_: Address of the ERC20 token used for payments
params.poolAddress_: Address of the yield pool for investment

params._period: Duration of the policy in days
params._premium: Premium to be paid for the policy

returns._0: The ID of the created policy

params._manager: The address of the Manager contract

approvePolicy(address).notice: Approve the policy after verifying no suspicious behavior or hack

checkPolicyValidity(address).notice: Check if a policy is still valid based on time and activity

claimPolicy().notice: Claim the policy payout if approved

constructor.notice: Constructor to initialize the contract with token and pool addresses

createPolicy(uint256,uint256,uint256).notice: Create a new insurance policy for the caller

getPolicy(address).notice: Retrieve the details of a specific policy

setManager(address).notice: Set the Manager contract to be used for vault address resolution
